title: Stun
data:
- *For the [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"), see [Stun (monster spell)](/wiki/Stun_\(monster_spell\) "Stun (monster spell)").*

A player or monster that is **stunned** has lost control over its movements. Stunning is a distinct condition from [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion") but has similar effects.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Player stunning](#Player_stunning)
- [2 Causes](#Causes)
- [3 Cures](#Cures)
- [4 Monster stunning](#Monster_stunning)
- [5 Messages](#Messages)
- [6 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
- [7 See also](#See_also)
- [8 References](#References)

## Player stunning

The most noticeable effect of stunning on [you](/wiki/You "You") is that whenever you try to choose a direction—to move, [fire](/wiki/Firing "Firing"), [zap](/wiki/Zap "Zap"), [apply](/wiki/Apply "Apply") some tools, et cetera—a random direction will be selected instead. If you press a movement key you will always attempt to move, even if the direction attempted is blocked, say by a wall. You will not be prompted for confirmation before attacking a [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful") or tame monster on an adjacent square, so as long as you are stunned there is a risk of accidentally angering peaceful monsters or [abusing](/wiki/Tameness#Abuse "Tameness") pets.

Other effects of being stunned:

- You can only throw or launch one projectile [at a time](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot"). It will probably not go in the direction you intended.
- You will be unable to [control your teleports](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control").
- If you throw [Mjollnir](/wiki/Mjollnir "Mjollnir"), you will be unable to catch it.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
- You will be unable to cast [spells](/wiki/Spell "Spell").

Unlike confusion, there are few, if any, practical reasons to get yourself stunned.

## Causes

- Becoming [nauseous](/wiki/Vomiting "Vomiting") as an effect of eating [tripe](/wiki/Tripe_ration "Tripe ration"), rotten [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg"), rotten [tinned](/wiki/Tin "Tin") food, etc.
- Attempting to cast a forgotten [spell](/wiki/Spell "Spell") (can also [confuse](/wiki/Confuse "Confuse") you)
- Applying a cursed [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")
- Opening or breaking a [trapped door](/wiki/Trap#Door_traps "Trap")
- Opening a [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") that turns out to be trapped
- Triggering a mind-altering gas [container trap](/wiki/Container_trap "Container trap")
- Eating the corpse of a [bat](/wiki/Bat "Bat") (any type) or [stalker](/wiki/Stalker "Stalker")
- Polymorphing into a [bat](/wiki/Bat "Bat") or [stalker](/wiki/Stalker "Stalker")
- The [stun](/wiki/Stun_\(monster_spell\) "Stun (monster spell)") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell")
- The [passive attack](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") of a [yellow mold](/wiki/Yellow_mold "Yellow mold")
- The melee attacks of an [abbot](/wiki/Abbot "Abbot"), [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon"), [Pestilence](/wiki/Pestilence "Pestilence") or [Famine](/wiki/Famine "Famine")
- The [gaze attacks](/wiki/Gaze_attack "Gaze attack") of [Baalzebub](/wiki/Baalzebub "Baalzebub") and [Archons](/wiki/Archon "Archon")
- Reading a cursed [scroll of destroy armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_destroy_armor "Scroll of destroy armor") while wearing cursed -7 armor
- Trying to eat a [rustproof](/wiki/Rustproof "Rustproof") item while polymorphed into a [rust monster](/wiki/Rust_monster "Rust monster")

[Magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation") does not prevent stunning attacks. [Free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action") will limit the duration of stunning from a monster spell to 1 turn.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Using a magic portal causes you to be stunned for three turns.

## Cures

Stunning can be cured by the following actions:

- [Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") an uncursed or blessed [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")
- [Praying](/wiki/Pray "Pray") (stunning counts as a [minor trouble](/wiki/Trouble "Trouble"))
- Waiting for it to wear off

The duration of stunning can be shortened by the following:

- Eating a [lizard corpse](/wiki/Lizard "Lizard") will set the stun counter to 2
- Getting blinded by an [Archon](/wiki/Archon "Archon") while not wearing the [Eyes of the Overworld](/wiki/Eyes_of_the_Overworld "Eyes of the Overworld") will set the stun counter to 1 to 3 [\[2\]](#cite_note-2)
- Getting stunned by a monster casting stunning while having [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") or [free action](/wiki/Ring_of_free_action "Ring of free action") will set the counter to 1.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

If you are already stunned, putting on the ring of free action does not in itself affect the stun duration.

## Monster stunning

Stunning has a less significant effect on monsters than on the player. It has the following effects:

- You (and only you) receive a +2 bonus to hit stunned monsters.
- Stunned monsters cannot block or evade your kicks.
- Stunned monsters are immune to your gaze attacks.
- Stunned monsters are less likely to jump out of the way of a falling portcullis or off a closing drawbridge.
- Stunned peaceful humanoids react differently when you #chat with them.
- Stunned spellcasting monsters are more likely to cast undirected spells, just as they would if they weren't adjacent to you. If they do this, they still get their normal turns, however.

Stunning does *not* cause a monster to move randomly or miss turns.

Each move, a monster has a 1/10 chance that it will stop being stunned. Monsters are also able to use a unicorn horn to cure their own stunning. [Bats](/wiki/Bat "Bat") and [Stalkers](/wiki/Stalker "Stalker") are permanently stunned, however.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Needs a new reference for bat/stalker stunning."*

Stunning can be inflicted on monsters by striking them with [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane") or successfully [jousting](/wiki/Joust "Joust") them.

## Messages

- You stagger...

  You became stunned, from an explosion or spell.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

- You wobble in the saddle.

  You became stunned while [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding").[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

- You can't seem to think straight.

  You became stunned from [nausea](/wiki/Vomiting "Vomiting").

- You feel a bit steadier.

  Your stunning wore off.

- You feel less wobbly now.

  Your stunning wore off, while you were [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating").[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

## SLASH'EM

- Stunning is one of the possible effects of eating a [mushroom](/wiki/Mushroom "Mushroom") or pink [pill](/wiki/Pill "Pill").
- The [glowing eye](/wiki/Glowing_eye "Glowing eye"), [bloodshot eye](/wiki/Bloodshot_eye "Bloodshot eye"), the [Beholder](/wiki/Beholder_\(monster\)#SLASH.27EM "Beholder (monster)"), and [Planetar and Solar](/wiki/Planetar_and_Solar "Planetar and Solar") have stunning gaze attacks. The [byakhee](/wiki/Byakhee "Byakhee") and [astral deva](/wiki/Astral_deva "Astral deva") have stunning melee attacks, and the [yellow jelly](/wiki/Yellow_jelly "Yellow jelly") has a stunning passive attack.
- Stunning can be cured by eating a white pill from a [medical kit](/wiki/Medical_kit "Medical kit") (if you are not already [sick](/wiki/Illness "Illness"), [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind"), [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating"), [vomiting](/wiki/Vomiting "Vomiting") or confused, *and* if the pill does not fail) or by praying (not sitting) on a [toilet](/wiki/Toilet "Toilet").
- You cannot use the [research](/wiki/Research "Research") [technique](/wiki/Technique "Technique") while stunned.

## See also

- [Confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion")
- [Impaired](/wiki/Impaired "Impaired")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1174](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/dothrow.c#L1174)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 2109](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/mhitu.c#L2109)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mcastu.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 455](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/mcastu.c#L455)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 99](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/potion.c#L99)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 97](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/potion.c#L97)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 92](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/potion.c#L92)

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Stun

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the monster spell, see Stun (monster spell).

A player or monster that is stunned has lost control over its movements. Stunning is a distinct condition from confusion but has similar effects.

Contents

  • 1 Player stunning
  • 2 Causes
  • 3 Cures
  • 4 Monster stunning
  • 5 Messages
  • 6 SLASH'EM
  • 7 See also
  • 8 References

Player stunning

The most noticeable effect of stunning on you is that whenever you try to choose a direction—to move, fire, zap, apply some tools, et cetera—a random direction will be selected instead. If you press a movement key you will always attempt to move, even if the direction attempted is blocked, say by a wall. You will not be prompted for confirmation before attacking a peaceful or tame monster on an adjacent square, so as long as you are stunned there is a risk of accidentally angering peaceful monsters or abusing pets.

Other effects of being stunned:

  • You can only throw or launch one projectile at a time. It will probably not go in the direction you intended.
  • You will be unable to control your teleports.
  • If you throw Mjollnir, you will be unable to catch it.[1]
  • You will be unable to cast spells.

Unlike confusion, there are few, if any, practical reasons to get yourself stunned.

Causes

  • Becoming nauseous as an effect of eating tripe, rotten eggs, rotten tinned food, etc.
  • Attempting to cast a forgotten spell (can also confuse you)
  • Applying a cursed unicorn horn
  • Opening or breaking a trapped door
  • Opening a cursed tin that turns out to be trapped
  • Triggering a mind-altering gas container trap
  • Eating the corpse of a bat (any type) or stalker
  • Polymorphing into a bat or stalker
  • The stun monster spell
  • The passive attack of a yellow mold
  • The melee attacks of an abbot, Demogorgon, Pestilence or Famine
  • The gaze attacks of Baalzebub and Archons
  • Reading a cursed scroll of destroy armor while wearing cursed -7 armor
  • Trying to eat a rustproof item while polymorphed into a rust monster

Magic cancellation does not prevent stunning attacks. Free action will limit the duration of stunning from a monster spell to 1 turn.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Using a magic portal causes you to be stunned for three turns.

Cures

Stunning can be cured by the following actions:

  • Applying an uncursed or blessed unicorn horn
  • Praying (stunning counts as a minor trouble)
  • Waiting for it to wear off

The duration of stunning can be shortened by the following:

  • Eating a lizard corpse will set the stun counter to 2
  • Getting blinded by an Archon while not wearing the Eyes of the Overworld will set the stun counter to 1 to 3 [2]
  • Getting stunned by a monster casting stunning while having magic resistance or free action will set the counter to 1.[3]

If you are already stunned, putting on the ring of free action does not in itself affect the stun duration.

Monster stunning

Stunning has a less significant effect on monsters than on the player. It has the following effects:

  • You (and only you) receive a +2 bonus to hit stunned monsters.
  • Stunned monsters cannot block or evade your kicks.
  • Stunned monsters are immune to your gaze attacks.
  • Stunned monsters are less likely to jump out of the way of a falling portcullis or off a closing drawbridge.
  • Stunned peaceful humanoids react differently when you #chat with them.
  • Stunned spellcasting monsters are more likely to cast undirected spells, just as they would if they weren't adjacent to you. If they do this, they still get their normal turns, however.

Stunning does not cause a monster to move randomly or miss turns.

Each move, a monster has a 1/10 chance that it will stop being stunned. Monsters are also able to use a unicorn horn to cure their own stunning. Bats and Stalkers are permanently stunned, however.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Needs a new reference for bat/stalker stunning."

Stunning can be inflicted on monsters by striking them with Magicbane or successfully jousting them.

Messages

You stagger...
You became stunned, from an explosion or spell.[4]
You wobble in the saddle.
You became stunned while riding.[5]
You can't seem to think straight.
You became stunned from nausea.
You feel a bit steadier.
Your stunning wore off.
You feel less wobbly now.
Your stunning wore off, while you were hallucinating.[6]

SLASH'EM

  • Stunning is one of the possible effects of eating a mushroom or pink pill.
  • The glowing eye, bloodshot eye, the Beholder, and Planetar and Solar have stunning gaze attacks. The byakhee and astral deva have stunning melee attacks, and the yellow jelly has a stunning passive attack.
  • Stunning can be cured by eating a white pill from a medical kit (if you are not already sick, blind, hallucinating, vomiting or confused, and if the pill does not fail) or by praying (not sitting) on a toilet.
  • You cannot use the research technique while stunned.

See also

  • Confusion
  • Impaired

References

  1. ↑ src/dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1174
  2. ↑ src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 2109
  3. ↑ src/mcastu.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 455
  4. ↑ src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 99
  5. ↑ src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 97
  6. ↑ src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 92


This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.

rawPage:
{{otheruses||the [[monster spell]]|Stun (monster spell)}}
A player or monster that is '''stunned''' has lost control over its movements.
Stunning is a distinct condition from [[confusion]] but has similar effects.

== Player stunning ==
The most noticeable effect of stunning on [[you]] is that whenever you try to choose a direction—to move, [[firing|fire]], [[zap]], [[apply]] some tools, et cetera—a random direction will be selected instead.  If you press a movement key you will always attempt to move, even if the direction attempted is blocked, say by a wall.  You will not be prompted for confirmation before attacking a [[peaceful]] or tame monster on an adjacent square, so as long as you are stunned there is a risk of accidentally angering peaceful monsters or [[Tameness#Abuse|abusing]] pets.

Other effects of being stunned:
* You can only throw or launch one projectile [[multishot|at a time]].  It will probably not go in the direction you intended.
* You will be unable to [[teleport control|control your teleports]].
* If you throw [[Mjollnir]], you will be unable to catch it.{{refsrc|src/dothrow.c|1174|version=NetHack 3.6.0}}
* You will be unable to cast [[spell]]s. 

Unlike confusion, there are few, if any, practical reasons to get yourself stunned.

== Causes ==
* Becoming [[vomiting|nauseous]] as an effect of eating [[tripe ration|tripe]], rotten [[egg]]s, rotten [[tin]]ned food, etc. 
* Attempting to cast a forgotten [[spell]] (can also [[confuse]] you)
* Applying a cursed [[unicorn horn]]
* Opening or breaking a [[Trap#Door traps|trapped door]]
* Opening a [[cursed]] [[tin]] that turns out to be trapped
* Triggering a mind-altering gas [[container trap]]
* Eating the corpse of a [[bat]] (any type) or [[stalker]]
* Polymorphing into a [[bat]] or [[stalker]]
* The [[stun (monster spell)|stun]] [[monster spell]]
* The [[passive attack]] of a [[yellow mold]]
* The melee attacks of an [[abbot]], [[Demogorgon]], [[Pestilence]] or [[Famine]]
* The [[gaze attack]]s of [[Baalzebub]] and [[Archon]]s
* Reading a cursed [[scroll of destroy armor]] while wearing cursed -7 armor
* Trying to eat a [[rustproof]] item while polymorphed into a [[rust monster]]

[[Magic cancellation]] does not prevent stunning attacks. [[Free action]] will limit the duration of stunning from a monster spell to 1 turn.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Using a magic portal causes you to be stunned for three turns.}}

== Cures ==

Stunning can be cured by the following actions:
* [[Apply]]ing an uncursed or blessed [[unicorn horn]]
* [[Pray]]ing (stunning counts as a [[Trouble|minor trouble]])
* Waiting for it to wear off

The duration of stunning can be shortened by the following:
* Eating a [[Lizard|lizard corpse]] will set the stun counter to 2
* Getting blinded by an [[Archon]] while not wearing the [[Eyes of the Overworld]] will set the stun counter to 1 to 3 {{refsrc|src/mhitu.c|2109|version=NetHack 3.6.0}}
* Getting stunned by a monster casting stunning while having [[magic resistance]] or [[Ring of free action|free action]] will set the counter to 1.{{refsrc|src/mcastu.c|455|version=NetHack 3.6.0}}

If you are already stunned, putting on the ring of free action does not in itself affect the stun duration.

== Monster stunning ==
Stunning has a less significant effect on monsters than on the player. It has the following effects:

* You (and only you) receive a +2 bonus to hit stunned monsters.
* Stunned monsters cannot block or evade your kicks.
* Stunned monsters are immune to your gaze attacks.
* Stunned monsters are less likely to jump out of the way of a falling portcullis or off a closing drawbridge.
* Stunned peaceful humanoids react differently when you #chat with them.
* Stunned spellcasting monsters are more likely to cast undirected spells, just as they would if they weren't adjacent to you. If they do this, they still get their normal turns, however.

Stunning does ''not'' cause a monster to move randomly or miss turns.

Each move, a monster has a 1/10 chance that it will stop being stunned. Monsters are also able to use a unicorn horn to cure their own stunning. [[Bat]]s and [[Stalker]]s are permanently stunned, however.
{{todo|Needs a new reference for bat/stalker stunning.}}

Stunning can be inflicted on monsters by striking them with [[Magicbane]] or successfully [[joust]]ing them.

==Messages==
;You stagger...
:You became stunned, from an explosion or spell.{{refsrc|src/potion.c|99|version=NetHack 3.6.0}}
;You wobble in the saddle.
:You became stunned while [[riding]].{{refsrc|src/potion.c|97|version=NetHack 3.6.0}}
;You can't seem to think straight.
:You became stunned from [[vomiting|nausea]].
;You feel a bit steadier.
:Your stunning wore off.
;You feel less wobbly now.
:Your stunning wore off, while you were [[hallucinating]].{{refsrc|src/potion.c|92|version=NetHack 3.6.0}}

==SLASH'EM==
* Stunning is one of the possible effects of eating a [[mushroom]] or pink [[pill]].
* The [[glowing eye]], [[bloodshot eye]], the [[beholder (monster)#SLASH'EM|Beholder]], and [[Planetar and Solar]] have stunning gaze attacks.  The [[byakhee]] and [[astral deva]] have stunning melee attacks, and the [[yellow jelly]] has a stunning passive attack.
* Stunning can be cured by eating a white pill from a [[medical kit]] (if you are not already [[Illness|sick]], [[blind]], [[hallucinating]], [[vomiting]] or confused, ''and'' if the pill does not fail) or by praying (not sitting) on a [[toilet]].
* You cannot use the [[research]] [[technique]] while stunned.

==See also==
* [[Confusion]]
* [[Impaired]]
